column4: anyone have any idea on how small "/boot" can be for a xubuntu install?
it depends on how much information you need stored there.  don't forget that all your user account settings _for every installed program that needs them_ are stored there
gah, you're right!  for some reason, i thought you said "/home"!  my mistake
considering all your kernel images reside in /boot, you might want to make it no less than 3 or 4GB
